summary: towers to the skies a million little battles “Arya,” he calls after her. He’s not sure why he does it. She stops, still facing...
caption:
towers to the skies

a million little battles

“Arya,” he calls after her. He’s not sure why he does it.

She stops, still facing away, her head tilted down. “I love you too, you know,” she says, quiet, like the words are being pulled out of her.

AO3

tags: characters dont have to be plot pushers to tell you something

all of it is telling you something

we had to see that to understand thr narrative in whole
some ppl really treat fiction like an rpg where characters have to fulfill specific roles or its meaningless
summary:
Arya’s story was not about being FM and killing Cersei.
It was always about the ongoing negotiation she makes with her...
body:
Arya’s story was not about being FM and killing Cersei.

It was always about the ongoing negotiation she makes with her identity/morality and the revenge she sought. It was a humanity arc. A personal tale from start to end.

Even in a shitty season, this was a question they sought to answer above all else.

If anything, it should’ve been clear that Arya would never kill Cersei once her list started to whittle down while Cersei lived. That was clearly going to the point where Arya would find the answer to her internal struggle. And find it she did. Not killing Cersei to save her own life instead of dying for this doomed hope of finding justice in more death is the great revelation for her and the readers/viewers as well.

The same damn people that cry about a reduction to assasin will whine that she didn’t wear Jaime Lannister’s face and kill Cersei as if that would lead to any end but immediate nihilistic destruction.

That was clearly going to the point where Arya would find the answer to her internal struggle. And find it she did. Not killing Cersei to save her own life instead of dying for this doomed hope of finding justice in more death is the great revelation for her and the readers/viewers as well.

The same damn people that cry about a reduction to assasin will whine that she didn’t wear Jaime Lannister’s face and kill Cersei as if that would lead to any end but immediate nihilistic destruction.
trail.content:

It was always about the ongoing negotiation she makes with her identity/morality and the revenge she sought. It was a humanity arc. A personal tale from start to end.

Even in a shitty season, this was a question they sought to answer above all else.

If anything, it should’ve been clear that Arya would never kill Cersei once her list started to whittle down while Cersei lived. That was clearly going to the point where Arya would find the answer to her internal struggle. And find it she did. Not killing Cersei to save her own life instead of dying for this doomed hope of finding justice in more death is the great revelation for her and the readers/viewers as well.

The same damn people that cry about a reduction to assasin will whine that she didn’t wear Jaime Lannister’s face and kill Cersei as if that would lead to any end but immediate nihilistic destruction.

summary: I personally enjoyed Sansa’s coronation. I still can’t watch it without crying because seeing my girl thrive makes me so...
body: I personally enjoyed Sansa’s coronation. I still can’t watch it without crying because seeing my girl thrive makes me so emotional. Needless to say that her siblings weren’t there because otherwise the cool final montage wouldn’t have been possible. Also, the fact that they’re in different places doesn’t mean that they’re never going to see each other again. Arya will come back home someday, Bran will visit her sister (or the other way around even though Sansa doesn’t like being in King’s Landing), and Jon will pull an uncle Benjen and be home as soon as possible.

blog.name: thequeenofhades
blog.title: "...then I wake up, like a thief of dreams."
blog.description: Elizabeth. 33. Writer. We are stardust my darling, we have galaxies in our hearts.

title: 6SS: Sansa & Arya: Hunters
body:
Follows this one: Warrior.

Arya watched as her sister walked towards her, hands balled into fists and a deep frown on her face, “…Did something happened?”

“Yes, a newbie just confused me with a librarian,” Sansa grumbled.

Arya snorted, quite amused, “You can’t blame them really, you don’t have the look of a hunter… you wear too much pink.”

“What side are you on? You’re supposed to side with me!”

Arya rolled her eyes, “I am, but I can still think it’s funny as hell; besides, he or she will learn soon enough that you’re a badass, so don’t sweat it too much, chill.”

Sansa took a deep breath, “I suppose you’re right, still, it’s annoying.”

*****

question: Sunday Six - Sansa & Arya - "Rematch?"
answer:
Sansa put down the controller with a groan, “I can’t believe I lost again, since when are you so good at Mario Kart?”

Arya snorted, “Since I’ve been practicing, so… rematch?”

Sansa glared at her sister, “If you pick rainbow road Arya, I swear to the gods…”

“Scout’s honor,” Arya smirked, “I won’t.”

“Fine, but let me go and get some snacks, I’m starting to get hungry, want anything?”

“Nah, I’m good,” Arya said, “but don’t take too long you loser, I’m looking forward beating you again!”

****

summary: The King and the Master of War - obsessivewriter - A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin [Archive of Our Own]
title: The King and the Master of War - obsessivewriter - A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapter 6 is finished and posted. Thank you all for your patience. 


 In this chapter:

 The Queen in the North still plays the game. Questions about a brother beyond the wall and about whispers of a secret affair.

Chapters: 6/? Fandom: A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin, Game of Thrones (TV) Rating: Explicit Warnings: No Archive Warnings Apply Relationships: Arya Stark/Gendry Waters Characters: Arya Stark, Gendry Waters, Davos Seaworth, Tyrion Lannister, Brienne of Tarth, Yara Greyjoy, Samwell Tarly, Bran Stark, Bronn (ASoIaF), Sansa Stark 

Summary:  Despite his humble origins, Gendry Baratheon is named king of Westeros, with Ser Arya Stark serving as his Master of War. Gendry is burning the candle at both ends: rebuilding the city during the day and secretly loving a woman at night.  

“You have nothing to say about that?” 

He asked, raising her chin with his hand and forcing her to look at him.  

“I’m the Master of War, not your Hand.” 

“I am not asking my Master of War right now, I am asking the woman who is presently naked in my furs.”

 Raised the rating to explicit because of a case of smut in chapter 4.

blog.title: s t o r m b o r n

summary:
Onward and Upward 
by @acropclis 
Summary:
"So you were hiding here, all this time? You're a wanted criminal!"
"I am."
"You...
body:
Onward and Upward - Chapter 1 - acropclis - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]

Onward and Upward

by @acropclis

Summary:

“So you were hiding here, all this time? You’re a wanted criminal!”

“I am.”

“You killed thousands of innocents!”

A pause. “I did.”

“You’re- You’re supposed to be dead!”

“I wish I was.”

Or the one where Daenerys was revived by Kinvara and is living in Volantis, and Arya decided to travel east, not west. They eventually meet again, and, through hardships and a lot of problems, manage to become friends, and heal.

The Dany angst will just dig into your heart. Daenerys is traumatized and depressed and needs a goddamn hug every paragraph and someone send me to Essos immediately.

Also, mom!Kinvara :)))

reblog.comment:

i've been working on a crossover fic
summary: Gendrya Modern AU - Late Night London Arya goes to a gig and sees her high school crush, Gendry, on stage.  She goes looking for...
caption:
Gendrya Modern AU - Late Night London

Arya goes to a gig and sees her high school crush, Gendry, on stage.  She goes looking for him afterwards…

“That’s a nice axe you played, you’ve gotten better.”

“Thanks, so have you… I mean… you look… good.”

“Thanks, so do you…”

(photos not mine)
